comments:
The following IndexOutOfBoundsException happens when I am using
"contextViewBindings" extension and "perspectiveExtensions" extension points.

I defined a view of my own, and expect to automatically open it in the "debug"
perspective when debugging my launch. I use "contextViewBindings" to defined
that behavior, and set autoOpen=true.

Then I use "perspectiveExtensions" to add this view into the debug perspective,
stack with the outline view, and visible=false.

Now when I debug something in another perpective, and hit a breakpoint, system
will automatically switch to the "debug" perspective.

WorkbenchPage.busySetPerspective() is called. And since the debug perspective is
not created, so:
newPersp = createPerspective(realDesc);    is called.


During creating the perspective, ViewStack.showPart() will be called for the
"outline view". But as the "ViewStack" is not really created yet (isDisposed()
return true), and

    	if (isDisposed()) {
    		return;
    	}
    	
        part.setContainer(this);
        ......

So "part.setContainer(this)" will not be called on the Outline view, and
outlineview's container will still be the ViewStack of previous perspective.


Then after createPerspective(realDesc) (in WorkbenchPage.busySetPerspective()) 
will call
setPerspective(newPersp);

And this will resulting the debug view being shown, the debug target get
selected, and resulting the view I defined to be automatically open.

Since my view is defined to be stack with the "outline view", so system find the
outline view, find its container --- And here is what went wrong: the
outlineview's container is still the viewstack of previous perspective, not the
viewstack of the debug perspective!!!.

Since the wrong view stack is used, and there is no place holder of my view in
that view stack, so when trying to do replace, IndexOutOfBoundsException will
happen!

While creating the part stack, a new view is being opened, presumably in the
same stack.  PartStack should handle this reentrancy.

I am working on a plugin with a similar problem, trying to put the Disassembler
view on top of the Outline view when entering the debugging context.

I think that the problem here is to do with the fact that when a LayoutPart is
added to the PartStack, it is supposed to have a reference to the container that
it thinks it is in. Stepping through the code, I see that the reference is not
kept up to date. This reference is used when switching from the C/C++
perspective to the Debug perspective: the Outline view and Disassembler view's
placeholders are added to the stack for the Debug perspective, but their
internal reference is not updated so they think that they are in the stack for
the Outline View in the C/C++ perpsective. This means that when they are
supposed to be replaced by the actual views, the search takes place in the wrong
stack resulting in attempt to replace a view at index -1.

I have a patch for the PartStack class (org.eclipse.ui.workbench plugin,
org.eclipse.internal package) which modifies the methods for adding LayoutParts
to update the LayoutPart's reference at the same time as adding it to the stack.
This seems to solve the problem.

Created an attachment (id=19115)
Modification to add() methods in PartStack

This patch is against version 3.0.1

This patch is too high risk for 3.1.

It makes sense for the getContainer pointer to point to the real container at
the time the part is added, but there is code that relies on some of the weird
specal cases involving the container pointer (such as the fact that the
container pointer is null when the widgetry doesn't exist, and the fact that
placeholders have different semantics for the pointer than regular parts).

Also, PartPanes are shared between perspectives, so their container pointer
should only be updated if the stack is part of the active perspective.

This code needs to be fixed before we can simplify the container pointer. I
tried to make this same code change before 3.0, but had to back out of it
because it created regressions.

Is this still a problem with Eclipse 3.1?  I tried writing a testcase, but was
not able to reproduce the IndexOutOfBoundsException.

I was able to cause a ConcurrentModificationException, and a view not showing up
when trying to open a view from a listener (on IPartListener2.partVisible).

I have updated the title accordingly.

The change suggested in comment #5 fixes the second problem. The first problem
can be fixed by iterating over a copy of the children in createControl().
Test and Fix released for builds >20050912
Verified by examining the source in I20050920-0010
